Hi,
  It does indeed appear that the python documentation link on
cantera.o=
rg is broken. However, you can generate your own using the
following proced=
ure.

 Do a "make" and then a "make install", in order to get the python
mo=
dules located in an appropriate directory within python's directory
search =
path.

Go back to the installation directory and go to tools/doc/python.

 =
Type:
  python mkmkdoc.py 
  chmod +x mkdoc
  mkdoc
  
This script creates =
a bunch of html files in the tools/doc/python
directory. Then, you can just=
 point your browser to the file: 
    tools/doc/python/Cantera.html

This i=
s the top node of the Cantera's python documentation. 

You can also make y=
our own doxygen documentation by going into tools/doc
and typing make. This=
 creates the doxygen documentation in
tools/doc/html. 
Then the top node is=
 to point your browser to is
tools/doc/html/index.html.

Best wishes,
Harry=
 Moffat
